weakness.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a fault in someone’s character or in a system, organization, design etc
weakness.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The legislation has a fundamental weakness.
The plan has strengths and weaknesses.
weakness.translation[0].definitions[1].d: lack of strength, power, or influence
weakness.translation[0].definitions[1].e: the growing weakness of local government
weakness.translation[0].definitions[2].d: the state of being physically weak
weakness.translation[0].definitions[3].d: lack of determination shown in someone’s behaviour
weakness.translation[0].definitions[3].e: He couldn’t explain his weakness in giving in to her demands.
I dared not cry or show any sign of weakness.
weakness.translation[0].definitions[4].d: the condition of not being worth a lot of money
weakness.translation[0].definitions[4].e: the weakness of the pound against the dollar
weakness.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a lack of power, success, or influence
weakness.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The stock market doesn’t fully reflect the weakness in the economy.
With this weakness in the market, buyers are able to name their prices and find willing sellers.
weakness.translation[1].definitions[1].d: part of something that can be criticized easily
weakness.translation[1].definitions[1].e: A major weakness of the firm has been its reliance on its headquarters in Atlanta for making decisions.
a serious weakness in the system
